practices.title: Use UX4G as the single source of UI truth
practices.guidance: Build interfaces using UX4G components and utility conventions instead of creating one-off custom patterns for common UI needs.

practices.title: Maintain visual and interaction consistency
practices.guidance: Keep spacing, component behavior, and layout structure consistent across screens to reduce cognitive load.

practices.title: Design and build for accessibility first
practices.guidance: Ensure proper semantics, keyboard operability, visible focus states, and sufficient color contrast in every component implementation.

practices.title: Follow a mobile-first responsive approach
practices.guidance: Start with small-screen layouts and progressively enhance for larger breakpoints using UX4G grid and utility classes.

practices.title: Use clear content hierarchy
practices.guidance: Prioritize key actions and information, use meaningful headings, and keep labels and helper text concise and task-oriented.

practices.title: Design forms for completion speed and accuracy
practices.guidance: Group related fields, keep validations explicit, provide actionable error messages, and minimize unnecessary inputs.

practices.title: Provide timely system feedback
practices.guidance: Always provide status or result feedback for user actions using alerts, loaders, progress indicators, and confirmation states.

practices.title: Keep navigation structure predictable
practices.guidance: Use familiar navigation patterns, preserve orientation with active states and breadcrumbs, and avoid deep, inconsistent branching.

practices.title: Optimize page performance
practices.guidance: Prefer lean component composition, avoid unnecessary JavaScript dependencies, and load only the required UX4G assets.

practices.title: Reuse canonical components before extending
practices.guidance: Choose existing UX4G components first and extend only when there is a validated product requirement that cannot be met by available patterns.

practices.title: Validate against UX4G conventions
practices.guidance: Review class usage, required attributes, and expected behavior to ensure implementations remain compliant with the design system.

practices.title: Design for inclusive public-facing services
practices.guidance: Use plain language, support diverse user capabilities, and reduce friction for first-time and low-digital-literacy users.
